post_text: Sending a warm welcome to all new staff and teachers joining our community for the 2020-2021 school year! Normally, around this time of year, we would be wrapping up a week of new-hire pre-service sessions and workshops at Explore's campus in Flatbush, Brooklyn. Our means for connecting and setting the tone for the 20-21 school year looks a little different this summer, but the energy, collaboration, and engagement is still palpable in our Zoom sessions. This week, our new staff have participated in important sessions focused on topics like our shared instructional priority for the year, norming on trauma-informed/responsive teaching practices, and applying an antiracist, equity lens to the core work we share as a community. We look forward to welcoming back our returning staff on Monday - Let's do this, Explore! #togetherwegrow #ExploreGoesRemote
text: Sending a warm welcome to all new staff and teachers joining our community for the 2020-2021 school year! Normally, around this time of year, we would be wrapping up a week of new-hire pre-service sessions and workshops at Explore's campus in Flatbush, Brooklyn. Our means for connecting and setting the tone for the 20-21 school year looks a little different this summer, but the energy, collaboration, and engagement is still palpable in our Zoom sessions. This week, our new staff have participated in important sessions focused on topics like our shared instructional priority for the year, norming on trauma-informed/responsive teaching practices, and applying an antiracist, equity lens to the core work we share as a community. We look forward to welcoming back our returning staff on Monday - Let's do this, Explore! #togetherwegrow #ExploreGoesRemote

post_text: Normally we celebrate Caribbean Heritage Month in June. Then, in September, during the Labor Day parade, the Caribbean culture is celebrated through colorful costumes, tasty foods, and joyful music and dance. However, in lieu of the cancellation of the 2020 Labor Day parade due to COVID-19, this week, we are excited to spotlight Caribbean people who made important contributions to our country. Swipe to learn more about the history of the parade, and virtual events happening this year. We also want to know where you're from! Comment with your flag - which country (or countries) are you representing today? :)

post_text:
The 20-21 school year is upon us, and with that comes the launch of our organization's shared instructional priority anchored in Zaretta Hammond's body of work around culturally responsive teaching and the brain.
.
We will provide appropriate challenges to stimulate brain growth and increase intellective capacity within our students. We will also take responsibility to reduce our students' socio-emotional stress from stereotype threat and microaggressions.
#togetherwegrow #sharedpriority

post_text: As we think about the upcoming school year, we want to revisit what is MOST IMPORTANT: embedding anti-white supremacy into all that we do and ensuring safe, joyful learning environments for our students. We are currently in stage 1 of our reopening plan, where our teachers will welcome students back, and build “classroom” communities by sharing about themselves in creative ways, and holding the space for students to do the same. We always want to incorporate our students’ interests, preferences and passions into instructional activities and interactions with them! You can find more information and resources regarding our COVID-19 and 2020-21 Reopening Plan here: https://sites.google.com/exploreschools.org/curriculum-materials/home/family-resources?authuser=0 Stay tuned for any updates to our reopening plan, and safety guidelines in future posts!

post_text:
We look forward to welcoming @blovesoulpower as our keynote speaker this preservice!
.
.
“Dr. Bettina L. Love is an award-winning author and the Athletic Association Endowed Professor at the University of Georgia. She is one of the field’s most esteemed educational researchers. Her writing, research, teaching, and activism meet at the intersection of race, education, abolition, and Black joy. Dr. Love is concerned with how educators working with parents and communities can build communal, civically engaged schools rooted in Abolitionist Teaching with the goal of intersectional social justice for equitable classrooms that love and affirm Black and Brown children. In 2020, Dr. Love co-founded the Abolitionist Teaching Network (ATN). ATN’s mission is simple: develop and support teachers and parents to fight injustice within their schools and communities. In 2020, Dr. Love was also named a member of the Old 4th Ward Economic Security Task Force with the Atlanta City Council. “ source: https://bettinalove.com/about/
text:
We look forward to welcoming @blovesoulpower as our keynote speaker this preservice!

Her writing, research, teaching, and activism meet at the intersection of race, education, abolition, and Black joy. Dr. Love is concerned with how educators working with parents and communities can build communal, civically engaged schools rooted in Abolitionist Teaching with the goal of intersectional social justice for equitable classrooms that love and affirm Black and Brown children. In 2020, Dr. Love co-founded the Abolitionist Teaching Network (ATN). ATN’s mission is simple: develop and support teachers and parents to fight injustice within their schools and communities. In 2020, Dr. Love was also named a member of the Old 4th Ward Economic Security Task Force with the Atlanta City Council. “ source: https://bettinalove.com/about/

post_text: Voter suppression manifests in many different ways and make it harder for certain demographics, such as people of color, students, the elderly, and people with disabilities, to cast a ballot. SWIPE to learn more about what voter suppression looks like (source: @aclu_nationwide) In our bio, you can find resources on what you can do to take action to protect your voter rights and the services that allow for casting an absentee ballot. #yourvotematters

post_text:
Repost from @excellowercharter
•
“If you are neutral in situations of injustice, you have chosen the side of the oppressor.” -Desmond Tutu⁣⁣
⁣⁣
We will Not sit in silence as racism and hate rips through our country. We will keep saying their names. #GeorgeFloyd #BreonnaTaylor #AhmaudArbery We say their names and the names of those before them whose lives were tragically taken too soon. We are here for you. We are here with you Excel Community. #BLACKLIVESMATTER ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
Photos: @shirien.creates

post_text: “Injustice anywhere is a threat to justice everywhere.”- Martin Luther King Jr. Our organization recognizes how critical it is to continue to acknowledge and work to dismantle the detrimental impact of racism and systems of oppression that affect many of our students and families. Today, we remember Ahmaud Arbery on what would have been his 26th birthday. If you are looking for ways to join the fight against racial injustice, we encourage that you participate in the #IRunWithMaud movement, while following social distancing guidelines to stay safe during this time. Should you be interested in helping to make sure that Ahmaud’s family have the resources needed for justice to be served, consider donating to the GoFundMe that his best friend created for the family – see link in bio. Please consider tagging us should you #RunWithMaud

post_text: Today is #NationalPrincipalsDay! When people ask, "What is the difference between the Explore Schools?" we have to preface our answer by highlighting that all of our schools operate as a community (#8schools1family!) in service of our Brooklyn students and families. However, each of our principals help cultivate their own school culture, guided by thoughtful, dedicated leadership. We are so thankful for everything that you do. ❤
text: Today is #NationalPrincipalsDay! When people ask, "What is the difference between the Explore Schools?" we have to preface our answer by highlighting that all of our schools operate as a community (#8schools1family!) in service of our Brooklyn students and families. post_text: After significant consideration and planning, we have decided to close all Explore Schools campuses on Monday, 3/16, and Tuesday, 3/17, in order for staff to begin planning for a possible longer-term school closure relating to COVID-19 (the novel Coronavirus). During this time, staff will be working to create and set up materials so that our students can continue learning from home. For more updates, please visit www.explorenetwork.org or see the link in our bio. Stay safe everyone!
text: After significant consideration and planning, we have decided to close all Explore Schools campuses on Monday, 3/16, and Tuesday, 3/17, in order for staff to begin planning for a possible longer-term school closure relating to COVID-19 (the novel Coronavirus). During this time, staff will be working to create and set up materials so that our students can continue learning from home. For more updates, please visit www.explorenetwork.org or see the link in our bio. Stay safe everyone!

post_text: At Explore Schools, we believe that while state exams are not the only measure of student achievement, the annual NYS ELA and Math exams are important measures of what our students know and are able to do – and an indicator that we’re heading in the right direction. We are so proud of our students and staff – our network continues to make gains! We’ve grown 15 percentage points in ELA and 27 percentage points in math since 2017. Follow us as we continue building on our hard work! 🎉

post_text:
When you think of the word “leader”, what comes to mind? No matter what role you are in at Explore Schools, you are a student in some way – always learning and developing in service of 2,000+ students in Brooklyn! We are seeking two Principal Residents who is committed to our mission, excellence and...learning! (Are you or someone you know a fit for this role? Check the link in our bio!) Continue reading as Tom Anthony, Empower Lower’s principal, shares a little about what lifelong learning looks like at Explore Schools!
.
“We are a community of learners. New staff members can expect to instantly be in a place of learning. We are here to make our staff members better in service to our kids – as such, we want to lead the people who are here, not just the work that is done. We are really attuned to making sure that we are growing our people to be the best that they can be in service to our kids.” – Tom Anthony

post_text:
If you’ve been following our posts this week, you know that we are hiring two Principal Residents to join our next class of outstanding leaders at Explore Schools! Learn more about this position – link in bio! You may also be wondering: why Explore? Anwar Abdul-Rahman, Principal at Explore Upper, shares what made him pick Explore – read more below!

"I chose to work at Explore for 2 reasons:

1st – Family: The family vibe here is incredible: folks will welcome you into the school community with a sense of fellowship amongst teachers, leaders and students. It is definitely a strong community.

2nd – Feedback: Feedback and coaching go tandem for me. The amount of coaching I’ve received here to help improve my practice has really improved my ability to do my job. Feedback for teachers has improved their abilities to do their jobs and we are also focusing on giving clear feedback for our students, and seeing that impact towards achieving higher than they have before."
- Anwar Abdul-Rahman @ Brooklyn, New York
text:

Feedback for teachers has improved their abilities to do their jobs and we are also focusing on giving clear feedback for our students, and seeing that impact towards achieving higher than they have before."

post_text:
Don’t miss our posts this week because we’re sharing information about our Principal Residency (link in bio) as well as highlighting what some of our principals have to say about working at Explore Schools! Keep reading to find out what Latasha Williams, Principal at Explore Lower, thinks about the work environment at Explore Schools:
.
.
“This is a great environment because of the people. We have an amazing team. We have leaders who are smart, work hard, and care. We have staff who go above and beyond, not just for their students but also for their peers. And we have fun. We genuinely care about each other, we come together as a community. We’re here for long hours, so we’ve build a home away from home: team and family." - Latasha Williams @ Brooklyn, New York

post_text:
#fbf Last week, world renowned fashion designer, Daniel “Dapper Dan” Day, visited our students at Explore Charter School! He opened up about the obstacles he faced and overcame as a young man in Harlem, his brief venture into journalism, the genealogy of gentrification in Harlem, and much more!

Dapper Dan empowered our students through his POS (Power of Self) mantra, and urged them to surround themselves with positive people and always strive for greatness! Thank you for inspiring the entire community, @dapperdanharlem! @ Explore Charter School
text:

Dapper Dan empowered our students through his POS (Power of Self) mantra, and urged them to surround themselves with positive people and always strive for greatness! Thank you for inspiring the entire community, @dapperdanharlem! @ Explore Charter School

post_text: Every May, on ABC Day (Anne’s Book Corner), authors visit Explore Charter School to inspire the next generation of poets and authors! This day is also a living memorial for our Founder Morty Ballen’s sister, Anne Ballen, who absolutely loved reading! What an amazing tradition that will forever live on and continue to be an opportunity for our students to explore their limitless potential!💫📚 #ABCDay #exploreyourpotential

post_text:
Do you live near the Brooklyn Botanical Gardens? If so, check out our Exceed Campus! Our vision at Exceed Upper is that in 2027, 2028, 2029, our scholars will graduate from college with an undergraduate degree and be on a path to pursue and explore their dreams.

The path begins with strategic high school placement instruction, and support to get our kids into the right college prep high school in NYC.

Apply today at: http://exploreschools.org/enroll-a-student/
to join our Exceed family!

Something that makes us unique is our focus on #equity - providing our scholars with what they NEED to succeed. The work we do is always grounded in what is best for our children, their families and communities. Enroll a student today! https://explore.schoolmint.net/signup #spreadtheword 🗣

post_text:
Carrie Mauer and Christina Froeb are so proud of the hard work on behalf of our staff, students and families resulting in dramatic gains on the NYS exams this year!

See below how much we grew in math and ELA compared to last year. When adults are all working together in service of student achievement, our students will achieve amazing things!
